question.text: Read the following statements and find out the INCORRECT statement.

options.text: In cockroach, brain supplies nerves to antennae and compound eyes.
Fat body, nephrocytes and uricose glands also helps in excretion in cockroach.

Male cockroach bears one ootheca that is a dark reddish to
blackish brown capsule, about 3/8" (8 mm) long.

solution.text: Cockroaches belong to phylum Arthropoda and class Insecta. The body is divided into head, thorax, and abdomen. Head bears compound eyes that are responsible for mosaic vision because each eye has many lenses. The brain is in the form of ganglia and nerves arise from these ganglia to supply eyes and antennae. Nephrocytes are major structures for excretion. Fat bodies and uricose glands in males are also for the same function. The ootheca is a dark reddish to blackish brown capsule, about 3/8" (8 mm) long in female reproductive structure, where the collateral glands secrete oothecal cover.
